blog

wow, it's been almost three years since i moved to san francisco! i haven't stayed in one place for three years since college (four years), which was kind of a while ago now. so i guess it's time to stop thinking of this city as "just a place i ended up because i got a job here" and more of a home. that might make it easier for me to connect with it. because i always feel like an outsider.

what's happened in those three years you ask?? well, a lot of things that are not really public website material because they involve career or personal stuff. that's what's so tricky about writing for this blog — anyone can see it! i gotta really be selective about what can go on here.

but just to name a few things... did all the usual touristy stuff you do in SF of course — the parks, the gardens, the piers, the hills; went to a few concerts — mostly jazz, one classical, one eurobeat; moved from a boring downtown neighborhood to a much livelier and more colorful neighborhood further out; cosplayed at a sacramento convention; traveled all over for work; visited acadia, seattle, and eureka for fun; ate a lot of good food (this could probably be broken out into its own post — there's so much good food here); splurged on a fancy piano so i can actually practice on a daily basis without having to find some practice room somewhere; and most importantly played a bunch of games with friends.

hmm doesn't sound like a ton of stuff when i lay it all out like that, especially for three years.

i gotta get out more... i just realized i haven't been to the zoo yet? i'm going to the zoo. bye
